result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raheem Demoney Winston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Bail Refund Packets.
11/12/15 bail refund notice mailed to surety/defendant.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Student Intern Daniel Murphy under the supervision of Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Pursuant to negotiations, case is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing in case#s 15CF206 & 15CF1116.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however defense attorney is in trial in another branch.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Motion hearing, however defense withdraws motion hearing and requests a projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
State's response to the defendant's motion to suppress. Received and filed.
Notice of motion and motion to suppress, received and filed.  aw
State's motion to join cases for trial, received and filed.  aw
This assigment is only effective as of 8/3/2015.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed on 5/27/2015.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22.  aw

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests a motion date.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Building.  State has filed a motion to join all three cases for trial.  Court stated Judge Witkowiak will rule on the joinder motion.  A substitution was previously filed.  Case is now assigned to Judge Witkowiak, branch 22.  Clerk contacted Judge Watts for the next court date.  Case adjourned for motion hearing on 8/24/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 22.  aw  Motion hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Court adds that the defendant be monitored at ENHANCED supervision with Justice Point with drug testing, no drug paraphernalia, and no firearms or dangerous weapons.  No possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  aw

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel may want to file a motion.  Defense to talk with client more to see how he wants to proceed.   State to file a motion to join defendant's three cases for trial.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/15/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Defendant to make all contacts with Justice Point.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Lin has been appointed.  Case adjourned to see how defendant wants to proceed on all three cases.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/27/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   Court reminds defendant to not possess or use any controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.  aw
  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
No attorney has been appointed yet for the defendant.  Case adjourned for status of counsel on 5/7/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Status conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
Defense counsel is retiring in June and requests to withdraw and have new counsel appointed.  Court grants motion to withdraw.  Case adjourned for status of counsel on 5/1/2015 at 9:00 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Status conference scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
Court is in trial.  Case set for scheduling conterence.  Defendant has two other pending cases.  Defense counsel is retiring and will have to withdraw from the case.  Case adjourned for motion hearing on 4/22/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Motion hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Paul Hauer for Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #15CF206 that are attached to the complaint. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: City of Glendale Police Department Detective Bryan Bichler. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed. Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/16/15.
HMP

15RM012083  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03/10/15

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  
Defendant Raheem Demoney Winston in custody.  
Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
